Radolfzell was developed out of a monastery founded in 826 AD as a "cell" under Bishop Radolf of Verona. 

The tourist information office is located at the train station (Bahnhofplatz 2). It's open Mo-Fr 9.00 - 18.00 and Sat 10.00 - 13.00
Radolfzell has no commercial airport. The closest airports are:

value: Zurich Airport (Switzerland). By car slightly over 1 hour to Radolfzell. By train 1.5 to 2 hours to Radolfzell.
Friedrichshafen Airport (Germany). By car 1 hour to Radolfzell. By train 1 to 1.5 hours to Radolfzell.
Stuttgart Airport (Germany). By car 2 hours to Radolfzell. By train 2.5 to 3 hours to Radolfzell.

Radolfzell can easily be reached by train, as it is an important railway junction in the
By bus: there is a bus network

through the city. All buses leave from the central bus station next to the train station. 

By taxi: Taxis are normally stationed outside the train station.

By foot: Radolfzell is pretty small and you can probably walk anywhere you want to go. The old town/pedestrian zone is compact and easily walkable.

value: directions=in the open area directly across from the train station
hours=Tue-Sun: 10-12.30, 14-17.30. Thurs open late until 20.00. Mondays and holidays closed
content=The relics of Radolfzell's patron saints (St.Theopont, St.Senesius and St.Zeno) are kept in this church.
directions=Right beside the train station. Use the underpass under the tracks to get to the lake
content=The lakeside has walking and cycle paths, a couple of restaurants, a beer garden, and a harbour.
price=Adults € 2, children 6 years and older € 1.30, under 6 free

content=The Radolfzell carnival takes place in the week leading up to Ash Wednesday, and includes events such as: "Hemdglonkerumzug" on Thursday where everyone dresses up in nightgowns and parades through down to chase out the ghosts of winter;  a big street parade on Sunday; a "fool's fair" in the market place on Monday; burning of the giant straw Carnival man to finish things off on Tuesday.

content=The third weekend in July is the feast of the patron saints of Radolfzell. There's a big festival at the waterfront on the weekend, and Monday morning citizens of Moos (across the lake) paddle over in flower-decorated boats for their annual pilgrimage.
content=The Christmas market is the first weekend in December. The main market place is filled with stalls selling mulled wine and food. There is live music.
content=Market days are Wednesday and Saturday.
content=The old section of town, in the pedestrian zone, is full of stores.
content=This bistro in the back of the Sonnenklar health food store serves organic, vegetarian meals. The menu changes every day. There are always about 5 or 6 options.
price=Single rooms € 79 to € 90, double rooms € 119 to € 150
(Schwarzwald) in Germany is about 2 hours away by train or 1.5 hours by car.
